$schema.title: Definition of schema
$schema.description: Definition of schema, should point to a valid package-manifest schema definition, e.g.: https://json-schema.boschrexroth.com/ctrlx-automation/ctrlx-os/apps/package-manifest/package-manifest.v1.schema.json

id.title: Identifier of the package
id.description: Unique identifier of the package. Must match the following RegEx: ^[0-9a-ZA-Z]. Must match the identifier defined in the snapcraft.yaml.

required.title: App is required app for system and not removable
required.description: Required marks an app as non-removable. This app isn't a system app by default but required for the functionality

dependencies.title: App dependencies
dependencies.summary: Dependencies required by the app providing the package-manifest

i18nTag.title: i18n Tag
i18nTag.description: can be used to supply translations of properties of the object this tag is applied to. The defined tag value must be unique in the scope of the package-manifest.

services.title: Services
services.description: Services contains a set of services a package is providing

proxyMapping.title: Proxy mappings
proxyMapping.description: Proxy mappings are used by the reverse proxy to assign specific routes to a server running on a device.

scopes-declaration.title: Scopes provided by the package
scopes-declaration.description: Scopes used in the application to control access to specific ressources. The scope declaration is used by the identity management (IDM) to assign permissions for specific users or groups.

menus.title: Menus
menus.description: Menus and links a package provides. The declarations will be used by the device admin to generate the corresponding entries in the sidebar or overview.

entries.description: A navigation entry point of the package
entries.title: Link

items.title: Sublinks
items.description: Sub entries of the entry point

link.title: Link to the ressource. The link includes the prefix of the service

target.title: Target
target.description: Specifies where to show the link. Identical to the target property of an anchor element.

id.description: Identifier of the link. Used to define menu orders.
id.title: Id

title.description: The text representation of the entry point
title.title: Title

description.description: The description of the entry point
description.title: Description

icon.description: An optional icon, see... to represent the entry point
icon.title: Icon

category.description: The category the entry point belongs to
category.title: Category

permissions.description: An optional list of permissions to enable the entry point
permissions.title: Permissions

commands.title: Commands
commands.description: Allows to specify commands that integrate into framework operations, e.g. for activeConfiguration. The sub-elements define the scopes that support command integration.

commandScope.title: Command Scope
commandScope.description: A command scope containing multiple commands.

command.title: Command
command.description: A command that is provided and can be executed by another application. A command can have multiple command requests, e.g. to execute the command on multiple services.

id.title: Id
id.description: The identifier of this command; must be unique within the enclosing scope.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Denotes what will be saved or loaded; used to inform users, e.g. in messages like 'Loading motion settings' or 'Cannot load motion settings'

after.description: Defines a list of command identifiers whose commands if present will always be executed before this command.

url.title: URL
url.description: The request URL. Called as a POST request. URLs starting with a slash are interpreted to be relative to https://<host>. The execution and url elements are mutually exclusive, that is exactly one of them is required.

execution.title: Execution
execution.description: The execution element is deprecated. Use url element instead.

method.title: HTTP method
method.description: The HTTP method called for executing this command; one of 'POST' and 'PUT'; the default is 'POST'.

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL used for executing this command

setOfScopes.title: Set of scopes
setOfScopes.description: A set of scopes declares the scopes which are supported by the web service. The set includes identifer, name, a human-readable description and one or more scopes.

identifier.title: The identifier of the scope set
identifier.description: The unique identifier of the permission set. Must be derived from the identifier and must not contain spaces. Must be unique.

name.title: The name of the scope set
name.description: The name of the scope set. Should be unique. Used by the identity management frontend to display the scope set.

description.title: Description of the scope set
description.description: The description of the scope set. Used by the identity management frontend to describe the scope set.

scopes.title: Array of scopes
scopes.description: Array of scopes. Each scope describes a specific permission for one or more web server resources, e.g. write to a resource using HTTP PUT

scope.title: Web server scope
scope.description: A scope represents a web service resource specific permission and consists of an identifier, a name and a human-readable description.

identifier.title: The identifier of the scope
identifier.description: The unique identifier of the scope. Must be derived from the id and follow the schema <id>.<service>.<scope_name>.<access_type>
examples: my-app.cool-feature.rw (allow read/write access to all resources
my-app.cool-feature.r (allow access to all resources on a read-only basis)

name.title: The name of the scope
name.description: The name of the scope set. Should be unique. Used by the identity management frontend to display the scope. Should describe the what the permission means.

description.title: Description of the scope
description.description: The description of the scope. Used by the identity management frontend to describe the scope set.
examples: This permissions allows to read and modify all automation parameters
This permissions allows to read all automation parameters
This permissions allows to read all motion parameters

requiredScopes.title: Array of required scopes
requiredScopes.description: Array of the scopes that might be required in addition to this scope in order to perform a specific action.

deprecated.title: Deprecated scope
deprecated.description: Indicates if the scope is deprecated and discouraged for future use.

requiredScope.title: The required scope
requiredScope.description: The scope which might be required by another scope in order to perform a specific action.

identifier.title: identifier
identifier.description: The identifier of the requried scope

proxyMapping.title: ProxyMapping
proxyMapping.description: ProxyMapping defines a web service mappings. A service has a name for identification, a relative path where it should be reachable and a socket (network or unix) to bind to

url.title: Url
url.description: Relative path the service is requesting

binding.title: Binding
binding.description: A network socket, e.g. :5000 or unix socket e.g. unix://{$SNAP_DATA}/package-run/my-app.web.sock

caddyfile.title: Customized caddy file
caddyfile.description: Path to customized caddy file, which should be included in the original caddy file

options.title: Additional options
options.description: Additional options of the proxy configuration

restricted.title: Restricted resources
restricted.description: Resources, to which the access shall be restricted, e.g. API URLs

path.description: Path, to which the access shall be restricted

except.description: Excepted subpaths, to which the access is not restricted

headersForwarding.description: Headers, which are created by idmconnector and forwarded to endpoint

oneOf.description: Path, which is restricted by identity manager

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Contains documents like API references, e.g.

document.title: Document
document.description: Specifies a reference to a document

type.title: Type of the document
type.description: Type of the document. Can be used for assignment purposes, e.g.

name.title: Name of the document
name.description: Name or title of the document. Can be used in headlines, e.g.

url.title: URL of the document
url.description: Specifies the path to the document resource.

description.title: Description of the document
description.description: Short description of the content of the document.
examples: Provides my-app related functionalities on ctrlX devices.

appDirectories.description: Describes app directories and specifies access to them inside the configuration

appPrivateFiles.description: Defines files which are ignored on saving and loading. The files are matched case-insensitively using regular expressions. Since XCR-V-0112.

items.title: Regular expression
items.description: A regular expression following the RE2 syntax (https://golang.org/s/re2syntax)

appDirectory.title: App directory
appDirectory.description: Describes an app configuration directory stored as part of a configuration.

name.title: Path of the app directory in the configuration
name.description: Path of the app directory. Subdirectories are separated with /, no leading or trailing /

description.title: Title
description.description: Short description of the content of the directory. Will be displayed as part of a configuration.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: An optional icon which represents the app.

copyOnLoad.title: Copy on load
copyOnLoad.description: An app is responsible for persisting its configuration state to the app data folder, even for the load command. With copyOnLoad, the app is able to delegate this task to the Solutions app.

writeProtected.title: Write-protection of app directories
writeProtected.description: An app can protect its directories in the active configuration against write-access, e.g. via WebDAV. Since XCR-V-0112.

scopes.title: Array of scopes
scopes.description: Array of scopes. Each scope describes a specific permission for one or more web server resources, e.g. write to a resource using HTTP PUT

certificateStore.title: Store for Certificates and Keys
certificateStore.description: certificate store enables your application to manage certificates and keys using Device Admin

id.title: Id of your store
id.description: Id of your store, should contain snap name as prefix, e.g. ctrlx-helloworld.certificates

title.title: Title of certificate store
title.description: Title of your certificate store that is displayed in ctrlX Device Admin UI

description.title: Description of your certificate store
description.description: Describes the content and usage of the certificates in the store
description.example: Certficates & Keys to connect to the World

scopesR.title: Scopes for viewing the certificate store
scopesR.description: A list of scopes that allow the user to have read access to this certificate store

scopesRWX.title: Scopes for managing the certificate store
scopesRWX.description: A list of scopes that allow the user to have full access to this certificate store

apps.title: Configurations for specific rexroth apps
apps.description: Contains configurations for specific rexroth apps

rexroth-remoteagent.title: Commands for remote device administration
rexroth-remoteagent.description: Contains allowed commands for remote device administration

commands.title: Remote device administration commands
commands.description: Remote device administration commands are used to execute commands on the device from the Nexeed Device Portal

rexroth-setup.description: Provides information for ctrlX Setup regarding the current app, e.g. settings to be saved and restored.

settings.description: App settings to be saved and restored by ctrlX Setup

name.description: Name of the setting. Must be unique within the app's settings list. Serves as key in the ctrlx-setup.json file. Required for all types except 'snapshot'. Note that the name '$path' is reserved.

description.description: Short localized description of the setting.

url.description: URL used to read (GET) and update (PUT) the setting. A URL starting with a slash is interpreted to be relative to https: //<host>. Required for all types except 'snapshot'.

type.description: Type of the setting. One of 'text', 'json', 'file', 'encryptedFile' and 'snapshot'. The default is 'text'.

dependencies.title: Map containing dependencies of the app
dependencies.description: Defines all dependencies of the app. The map key is the unique app id. Only direct dependencies should be modeled here.

^[a-z0-9-]*[a-z][a-z0-9-]*$.title: Version range defined as string
^[a-z0-9-]*[a-z][a-z0-9-]*$.description: Definition of the version range using npmjs syntax, see https://semver.npmjs.com/ for more details.

title.title: Human readable title of the firewall

required.title: Indicates if an licenses is required to operate the application or unlocks optional functionalities

supportsTrial.title: Indicates if the license can be used within the app's trial mode

licenses.title: Contains license informations for specific rexroth apps
licenses.description: Licenses are used to control the functionality of the package. Missing licenses results in no or not full availibility

uiExtensions.title: Contains ui extensions for the home screen

uiExtensionHeaderItems.title: Header items
uiExtensionHeaderItems.description: Web components that should be displayed in the global header.

order.title: Order
order.description: Order of the item in the header. Lower numbers are displayed first.

src.title: Source
src.description: The url of the web component's implementation file.

tag.title: Tag
tag.description: The tag name that creates a new instance of the web component.

uiExtensionDashboardItems.title: Dashboard items
uiExtensionDashboardItems.description: Web components that should be displayed in the dashboard.

order.title: Order
order.description: Order of the item in the header. Lower numbers are displayed first.

src.title: Source
src.description: The url of the web component's implementation file.

tag.title: Tag
tag.description: The tag name that creates a new instance of the web component.

title.description: The widget's title as shown in the widget catalog.

description.description: The widget's description as shown in the widget catalog.
description.example: Shows the status of your axes

icon.description: The icon to be displayed in the widget catalog.

image.description: The path to the image to be displayed in the widget catalog.

permissions.description: List of permissions to view or interact with the widget.

categories.description: List of categories the widget is displayed

settingsTag.description: The tag name that creates a new instance of the web component for the settings.

noInitialCreation.description: If true, the widget isn't created initially.

cols.description: Number of columns in the dashboard grid.

rows.description: Number of rows in the dashboard grid.

specificConfigTag.description: The specific configuration of the widget. The content is defined by the widget developer.
